item.value: The shortest person in the world is Khagendra Thapa Maga. He is 56 cm ( 22 in ) tall.
Yuma in the state of Arizona has over 4,000 hours of sunshine per year - making it the sunniest place on the planet. The South Pole is the least sunny place with only 182 days a year off sunshine
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is only 4.6 billion years old.
Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
Diamonds are the hardest substance known to man. A diamond is 58 times harder than the next hardest mineral on earth.
John Logie Baird was the inventor of the world's first working television system in Hastings, England in 1923.
The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system. Jupiter is the largest planet.
By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billion telephone lines in the world.
The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
In 1932 Amelia Earhart became the first woman to do a solo transatlantic flight. She flew from Harbor Grace, Newfoundland, to Ireland in approximately 15 hr.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters. The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
On July 20, 1969, Neil Armstrong became the first human to step on the moon.
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
House flies have a lifespan of two weeks.
The Surface Area of the earth is 197 million square miles, about two thirds of the Earth's surface is covered with water.
Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first powered, sustained, and controlled flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903. In 1919 the First transatlantic flight was made.
